update.description:
Finish implementing OgreRTShaderSystem and ported rtshader media resources from gazebo. This enables shadows in ogre render engine, e.g. to test, run `custom_scene_viewer` example and switch to a scene with objects in it to see shadows cast on the ground plane.

Also pimpl'ized OgreRTShaderSystem class

Added `IGN_RENDERING_RESOURCE_PATH` which is used by 

  * optix to look for compiled ptx files and 

  * ogre to look for rtshader files

Added shadows integration test

TODO

  * support user specified paths for locating media resources
update.title: Add Ogre rtshaderlib and enable shadows

pull_request.title: Add Ogre rtshaderlib and enable shadows

pullrequest.title: Add Ogre rtshaderlib and enable shadows

content.raw: `rtshaderlib150` uses glsl version 150. Ogre code also assumes that the glsl version declaration are not present in the shader code otherwise it doesn't compile. So for ogre1.9 we'll need 150 version. Ogre versions < 1.9 uses `rtshaderlib` instead of `rtshaderlib150`
content.html: rtshaderlib150 uses glsl version 150. Ogre code also assumes that the glsl version declaration are not present in the shader code otherwise it doesn't compile. So for ogre1.9 we'll need 150 version. Ogre versions < 1.9 uses rtshaderlib instead of rtshaderlib150

pullrequest.title: Add Ogre rtshaderlib and enable shadows

content.raw: currently the rendering engines used in tests are hardcoded. So for systems that do not have `optix` for example, I'll just let it print out this debug statement and not fail the test.
content.html: currently the rendering engines used in tests are hardcoded. So for systems that do not have optix for example, I'll just let it print out this debug statement and not fail the test.
